desc: We had the most wonderful time staying at Naumi. From the moment we arrived ( at 7:30am, obviously too early for check-in) we were warmly welcomed. Our bags were stored for us and we were invited to use the showers to freshen up if required. The showers were on the 10th floor, just indoors from the rooftop infinity pool! When we returned to our room later in the day we were thoroughly delighted!! The most comfortable bed, beautiful facilities including a coffee machine! Buffet breakfasts were delicious!!! And the rooftop pool was amazing, and had the pool to ourselves everytime we used it! It really felt like our own personal area!! We thoroughly recommend Naumi to anyone visiting Singapore.....and we are around the corner from Raffles for the iconic Singapore Slings!!

title: Great service, good location
desc: Nothing was too much trouble for front desk or waiting staff - super pleasant, helpful and genuinely interested. Hotel spotlessly clean. Room has everything you need. Infinity pool a bonus and unexpectedly lovely diversion - worth checking it will be open if it is top priority for you - it was closed one evening we were there for a wedding party. A short walk to MRT, close to all the action. Would highly recommend and will return.

title: Fabulous hotel in a perfect location!
desc: We stayed for 3 nights and loved our stay at Naumi and Singapore and whilst very pricey it was a wonderful stay. The front desk were always helpful and friendly and thankfully on arrival early at 9am from a long haul flight from the UK we were so grateful to be given a free room early! This made our stay as allowed us to shower, unpack and head out and hour or so later feeling refreshed and ready to.see.the sights. Singapore is an.amazing city and Naumi is located brilliantly so that everything is within a short walk away. So close that we walked everywhere easily. Raffles hotel is next door but it's covered in scaffolding and dont expect any views from any rooms as it's just not tall.enough but that doesn't matter at all because the best view is from the pool and boy is this

title: Warm and welcoming hotel
desc: A boutique hotel which is warm and welcoming. It is a great location for business and leisure travelers. The rooftop bar has a wonderful view of the Singapore skyline. Rooms are very well appointed, with coffee machines and very fast wifi.

title: Great little hotel
desc: Nice hotel with a great presentation and all the amenities - gyms, infinity pool, bar, poolside bar. Comfortable rooms with ingenious use of space in the rooms to store all the mod cons. Friendly helpful staff who remembered my name after two nights! Continental breakfast both western and eastern tastes and they will cook eggs or pancakes should you so desire Lots of surrounding eateries and bars. Only down side is it is a bit of a hike to the MTR

title: Personal and perfect location
desc: Staff so friendly and we treated personally. The location is so perfect, surrounded bisnis district area and memorable beautiful buildings, comfortable for walk and enjoy the neigbourhood. Just 5 minutes walk to the MRT station.

title: Excellent
desc: Great service at the front desk. Stylist deco. Clean and tidy. Comfy shower and bed. Complimentary snack bar is great (tho i remember they served free alcohol at the snack bar before.) All in all, a great experience. Will definitely come back.

title: Great Roof Top Bar in a great location
desc: Had a one staycation here courtesy of AMEX (Thank you)! Enjoyed our stay, it's a trendy little hotel with a great roof top bar and pool overlooking the Singapore skyline. Had dinner here, great big servings of good Indian food. The breakfast was also decent. Very friendly staff but best of all is the location, centred between easy walks to Bugis, Suntec, Padang and the River, City Hall. I'd highly recommend.

title: Enjoy Personalized Service from Naumi
desc: Be impressed by the quality service of the friendly stuff the moment you arrived! The front desk staff lead us personally to the room and gave us a detailed guide of the room knowing that it was the first time we were there. The Oasis room is indeed cozy and comfortable! We will definitely go back there again.

title: Quirky and stylish
desc: Naumi is a small boutique hotel in a great location next to Raffles. Every member of staff was friendly and professional. The room was comfortable and the bed large! There was a fridge with mini bar and a small safe in a drawer by the bed. The bathroom was clean and modern with a large shower and a separate bath. The water was always hot and plentiful. I found the waterfall tap style in the sink was a tad tricky to control but that is being very picky! Breakfast was great with a wide choice of pastries, fresh fruit, yogurts, juices, and Asian hot food as well as a good selection of teas (I’m fussy about tea!). They will also cook eggs according to your preference. The pool is on the roof and provides a great view across the city. Again, if I were being very picky, I’d have liked

title: Very nice Hotel
desc: If you want to have a nice stay in Singapore, I defenetly recomend Naumi Hotel. Very central place, the staff were always impeccable and everything was clean. Thank you so much for the hospitality, Naumi Hotel.

title: Gorge Boutique Hotel!
desc: Amazing hotel and perfect spot to stay for a short visit to Singapore! The staff were all lovely and very friendly. The rooftop spot was a fab little addition too and the rooms were fab! Lots of nice little freebies in the room which was amazing! Would highly recommend the hotel and perfect for a more unique experience. We didn't get to try the breakfast but we did have some dinner one night which was really nice. The only slight negative to add would be that the service was a little slow when ordering anything drinks/food etc. We did experience this a lot in Singapore so not just at the hotel - nothing that would put you off though :)

title: single night stay for transit
desc: nice room for a single traveler. espresso machine works great. good location and can walk to see marina bay. love the view from the swimming pool. people staying there are cool. not easy to fined the hotel from MRT station.

title: Great place to stay in Singapore
desc: Everything was fantastic from the check-in, room, pool and hospitallity. The location of this beautique hotel is very convenient to many attractions and overlooks the Raffles Hotel. Will definitely be staying here again.

title: Start of a round the world tour!
desc: Naumi Hotel is a beautiful, intimate and very comfortable place to stay, the staff are wonderfully friendly, especially Tiara on reception. It is definitely a boutique hotel (an overused description sometimes) it’s chic, beautifully decorated with lovey little touches here and there. And as if the brilliant central location wasn’t enough... it’s all topped off with the most amazing city skyline view from the rooftop bar and infinity pool! Next time I’m in Singapore I wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

title: Modern, comfortable and central hotel
desc: We stayed for 5 nights in Naumi and were pleasantly surprised at the modern, clean and functional room. The view from the roof bar in the evening was special and the service from the enthusiastic bar man were excellent.

title: Nice Little Staycation!
desc: Checked into Naumi with spouse without kids tagging along. First thing is the reception staff are very friendly. Second would be the decors in the room. Thirdly would be the drink bar which is totally complimentary. Although the rooms are not very spacious but the atmosphere and human touch given makes up for it. Would definitely return for another staycation!

title: Great hotel with an amazing view
desc: I enjoyed everything about this hotel. From the staff, to the room, and to the rooftop infinity pool view, I definitely enjoyed my stay. It’s also centrally located in Singapore. It was within walking distance from the marina.

title: Great place
desc: Loved Naumi, cutting edge design. Good amenities, good position. Specially loved the infinity pool on top level. Staff very helpful and courteous. Comfortable bed .would recommend . I was a single traveller and delighted with my stay.

title: Singapore visit 4 days
desc: Excellent service, staff are helpful, nothing is too much trouble. Fridge stocked daily and water left at no charge. Room was clean and comfortable. Infinity swimming pool overlooking the city. Will definitely return

title: Fancy
desc: Really nice butique hotel. Even The lobby smelled nice. Room was nice and the bed was excellent. Enjoyed my time there really much. Service was also excellent. We were really welcomed eventhough we were a bit dirty backpackers. Location is good If you enjoy your time on the middle of Singapores centre. The Infinity pool is a bit small If place is crowded.

title: Excellent boutique, superbly located.
desc: 5 mins from Rd Hop on Hop off route, 15 mins from Chinatown (MRT & yellow Hop on Hop off route). Take Heritage Double room - just large enough for 2 adults. Very comfortable, and for Singapore very economical. A great place a very helpful staff.

title: Fantastic hotel & team
desc: We spent two nights at this wonderful hotel and have to report it was simply perfect in every way. The service was excellent, very friendly and helpful and the facilities were equally awesome. When we come back to Singapore we will definitively stay here again. A must stay!!

title: Wonderful place to stay
desc: 15 min walk to Marina, small but well spaced and decorated clean rooms. The very friendly staff was helpful with city informations and booking city events. Breakfest was of a very good quality. Highly recommended Naumi Hotel.

title: Short stay visit
desc: Quaint little Hotel in Chinatown in Singapore. The staff was very helpful, and the room was clean but small. There were no windows in any of the rooms that we observed. For a short stay, we found the hotel adequate and inexpensive. There was no breakfast, but many restaurants are within about one block from the hotel, and the service from the staff was very personal, and they actually took the time to walk us to a restaurant and show us how to get to a bus stop. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Highly recommended
desc: Great location. Center of the city. Lots of buses and near MRT station. Can assess to most of attractions, Lots of restaurants nearby, including 2 restaurants famous for Hainonese Chicken rice. Nice hospitality. Room is clean and cosy. Will recommend to others.

title: Great Hotel
desc: We spent 4 nights at the Naumi Hotel and it was fantastic. Great location, well designed and well equiped rooms, plus the staff are very helpful and friendly. Perfect hotel for a site seeing city break in Singapore.

title: Dec 17
desc: Great stay. Superb location. Rooms are trendy and well equipped. Free Netflix was great. Enjoyed the pool area too - it has a lot of places to chill out but was never too busy. Reception and hotel staff are very friendly - nothing too much trouble.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in good location
desc: Modern clean artful design in a smaller hotel with good service, very clean with a great calm feel and dramatic view pool on roof. I left my passport in the safe and didn’t realized until I was at the airport. The front desk found it an put it in a cab to meet me in the airport in time. Well beyond expectation!

title: Great location
desc: Good value, small central hotel, just behind Raffles, modern designer style and therefore sometimes not practical, eg glass door on toilet, no socket near mirror for hair dryer, gimmicky tap, splashes easily. Great little infinity pool with excellent views over the city, good breakfast. Very comfortable bed.Helpful staff, very accommodating about leaving luggage after check out.Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Soulful boutique experience
desc: Staff on arrived were extremely friendly. Room was lovely, quite spacious and had ambient music to set the scene. The main draw is the infinity pool where you can selfy yourself against the skyline. I had a night flight after checkout, but the staff permitted me to use the common area to sort out my next destination, and provided gels etc for the shower so I could wash and freshen up after a sweaty day around Singapore

title: Wonderful staycation
desc: Had a voucher for one night stay. Was wonderfully surprised at the beautifully decorated and well thought of amenities. Everything in the mini bar was complimentary. There were multi plugs to charge your phones. You could mirror your phone to the TV and basically watch anything on your phone via the television. The bath tub was huge and deep, unlike most hotels. There is an infinity pool at the top of the building too. Breakfast is served in the coffee house which serves Indian food Table by Rang Mahal.

title: Naumi First Visit
desc: I was very pleased with my first stay at this hotel. Really enjoyed it. The staff was exceptional and the rooms were well fitted and comfortable. Would have preferred a better equipped gym with more weights but out with this monir issue, it is a very nice place. Kudos to the Duty Manager who made arrangements for the breakfast chef to ome in an hour earier than usual to ensure we had a nice meal before heading to Johor for business. You would not get this kind of service from major chains in Singapore. I will certainly visit there again!

title: Fantastic boutique hotel
desc: Visited as part of a local staycation with my family. Very good location as it is near to both Suntec City and Bugis Junction. Very good infinity pool at level 10 with fantastic views. Staff is friendly and helpful. Got the habitat room. Excellent mini bar with expresso machine.

title: Mr
desc: Great location. Very nice and cozy hotel. Terrific and extremely helpful staff. The pool on the roof is nice and a good place to relax for a bit in the middle of a hot day. The only negatives that we have found is a combined shower and a toilet with no shower curtain or a door which makes everything wet. No convenient places to hang the towels and a sink is inside the room which makes it somewhat inconvenient and gives lack of privacy. Again no place to hang the towels near the sink and water splashes while washing up makes floor and nearby luggage a bit wet.

title: Excellent small hotel in center of Singapore
desc: If you are looking for a small personal Hotel with excellent service - Naumi is a great choice. The rooms are small but very nice decorated, modern looking. Beds are comfortable, and you have a complimentary minibar with soft drinks, coffee (Nespresso machine) and a kettle for Tea, as well as some snacks. The breakfast is awsome, all what you need, and a lot of healthy choices. However, we missed some plain youghurt for the breakfast buffé. The pool and poolbar has a nice view over Singapore, and it was a nice place to relax after a busy day. The straff is very service minded. We would love to go back again.

title: Beautiful room, stunning locale, considerate service
desc: This was our first stop in Singapore and couldn't of felt more welcome from the first day. Motivated and comprehensive service from the staff. Breakfast buffet was a delight, with jovial waitpeople and an extensive selection - items can be made to order. Room had a FREE minibar selection. Michelle at the concierge was very knowledgeable about the wider inner city area. Infinity rooftop pool is intimate and stunning, morning and night. They have not seen the last of us XD

title: Staycation from 15-17 Dec 2017
desc: A lovely getaway in my own country. It was supposed to be a stay for my overseas friend to attend my wedding but she can't join eventually. The hotel is very kind to convert the prepayment stay to a staycation for me. It has comfy room & provided complimentary beverages & snacks. Overall good service and nice breakfast.

title: boutique hipster hotel
desc: location was excellent next to Raffles and Fairmont shopping mall,, room was small but very modern , rooftop infinity pool where we had dinner was a "10", staff who were mostly women were very efficient and helpful

title: Nice
desc: Have just returned from a quick one night stay at this lovely hotel. The staff were all exceptionally helpful and friendly and really couldn't do enough to make your stay enjoyable. The hotel is truly beautiful, everywhere is spotlessly clean and decorated and furnished grandly. The room had a lovely view over the park. It was furnished but the building was very large and the lot upstairs was made of a little cramped also the bed, which was extremely high making it very difficult for my petite mum to get on and off easily without some help. However, there are very many thoughtful touches and a lovely large bathroom with a very comfortable and pleasant stay.

title: absolutely amazing hotel with great rooftop pool
desc: great hotel, very polite employees. They let us check in early (at 8 am) which was great after 12 hours flight. good location- walking distance to the city, restaurants and mini markets are around and the rooftop view is just amazing.

title: Affordable luxury in the City of Lions
desc: Last summer, I spent a few days in Singapore and stayed at this amazing little boutique hotel. Standing in the shadows of the iconic Raffles Hotel, the Naumi holds its own well. At the time of my visit, the Raffles was under renovations but had a pop up gift shop and a Singapore Sling bar. Don't bother with the bar unless you love to pay £15 for a cocktail you can get in the Naumi bar for £8. Anyway, the hotel room was very large and modern. The bed was comfortable and had very large pillows which made for a very nice rest. The rooms come with a rain shower and one of the funkiest tap faucets I have ever seen. You are only about 10 minutes from the tube which can get you anywhere in Singapore. If you are up for it, you can walk to Marina Bay Sands in about 30 minutes if you

title: Amazing!
desc: Booked a night’s stay to celebrate my boyfriend’s birthday. Room was rly pretty and quite spacious. They had a lot of free perks (free minibar iirc). Bathtub was really nice as well. The bellboy asked us otw to our rooms re the occasion and the hotel staff surprised us w a cake and card afterwards. Really thoughtful! Wld def stay again

title: Great staff made up for tiny room
desc: Naumi was well-situated right near Raffles and some great dining options in Singapore, making it a great home base for exploring the city. The hotel itself feels very new, clean and modern; if you can handle the overly cheeky phrases on everything from water bottles to walls, then it’s all upside. We traveled with a one-year-old, so the room was a bit cramped but we made do. The staff was very helpful, calling us Grab cars, providing directions and always smiling at our daughter when we came in and out. The gym is very cramped, but I can’t really complain because I was just happy that a small boutique hotel had a gym option at all!

title: BEST stay!
desc: Great boutique hotel with everything you need and v friendly staff. The pool is small but all you need to cool off. There is currently refurbishment works but they were not a bother. The staff are wonderful and the hotel is very cute. Room is very comfy with Apple TV! we booked an oasis room.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in great location
desc: A really great little boutique hotel in the midst of huge skyscraper hotels in Bangkok, great find with lots of character and lovely attention to detail throughout the property. Room was truly lovely, with a big comfy bed and lovely bathroom facilities. The pool as well is a great area, with a great view. Location again excellent, it's a stones throw from raffles and the marina. We were dissapointed that we weren't informed before we booked or arrived or on arrival that they were doing maintenance work. This would of been fine but they were hammering and drilling at 8am on the morning we were there. And the pool area directly behind they were doing loud work most of the day - which makes relaxing in the pool a little hard. Such a shame as it's a gorgeous place. But a heads up

title: Best of 3 places stayed in Singapore
desc: From the time we arrived at reception we felt a sense of ease and comfort in making the right decision to stay here.The young lady at reception took us to our room explained everything and was totally brilliant.Beds great ,nespresso machine ,soft drinks replenished daily and some complimentary snacks and beer to kick of first day.infinity pool on 8th floor and close to plenty of eateries and happy hour at hotel for$6 beers house wines etc.really recommend this place.

title: Great start to our honeymoon in SE Asia
desc: Beautifully finished hotel, with a gorgeous rooftop pool. Very well appointed rooms, complete with nespresso machine which was a wonderful addition. Rainfall shower was lovely as well. Fantastic location next to raffles ( unfortunately we visited when raffles were having building work but that can't be helped) and walkning distance to the marina/marina bay sands, orchard road, we pretty much walked everywhere except when we went to chinatown! The concierge was excellent too - very quick to respond to emails. Would definately stay again

title: Another pleasurable visit at the Naumi on Seah Street
desc: We have frequently visited Singapore over the years and always find the Naumi to be a wonderful place to stay. The location and comfort level can not be beat, and the lodging is reasonably priced,as well. The Naumi's true appeal and strength rests with their wonderful staff. This boutique hotel is small and all the employees we met truly have grasped the importance of personal interactions with their guests. Michelle Tng, the manager during our stay, was both knowledgeable and charming. She is a talented asset for the Naumi. All in all, we look forward to our next visit....

title: Lovely boutique
desc: A wonderfully boutique experience - oasis room with clean, white design, divine free-standing bath.. Close to city hall station. Enjoy the rooftop pool (being extended). Great restaurant - Table - excellent Indian fare and good-value set lunch menu.

title: Excellent hospitality and good services
desc: We were treated outstandingly by Syakir and his colleagues at Naumi. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome and give us recommendations of places to visit in Singapore. The roof top pool was great. The room, with patio, was nice, a bit quirky. We enjoyed the Nespresso machine and free soft drinks in the minibar. Wifi was good but limited to one account per room until we asked reception for another password. There is a fitness room, split into one cardio room and one room with some weights. The location was great, just across the road from the Raffles hotel. Overall good value and recommended.

title: Naumi needs a hug
desc: For a short street, Seah Street packs a lot in. Aside from Naumi, it also houses the side entrance to Raffles, and numerous bars and decent food outlets along its 200m length; and with Raffles Place shopping mall and City Hall MRT station a 5 minute street level walk away, it's a great location for this small boutique hotel. It does, however, come at the cost of some street noise, particularly on the lower levels on weekends. Get a high level if you can. There are numerous good things on offer at Naumi - the friendly and helpful staff for one, and the rooftop pool and deck which, although small (and potentially crowded at peak times), is a great place to cool off gazing at the city lights over sunset. The oasis room is small but reasonably well laid out; the bed is comfortable -

title: Fabulous boutique hotel
desc: This is an excellent boutique hotel located in prime central location of Singapore, a lot of wow effects amenities quite pleasant to discover, like the glass shower that turns opaque at the push of a button etc. Will stay there again without any hesitation, a real gem, thanks!

title: Great Stay
desc: My second stay at my local favourite boutique hotel. Always had a great experience! Great service by most staff (A staff at the restaurant came across as rude to me but that's fine). Definitely will be back once they finish their renovations.

title: Naumi is a great choice.
desc: We chose the Oasis room. Small, but that's Singapore. Superb location. Very pleasant, well supplied room with lots of light and excellent view. Superb service. Rooftop bar under renovation so can only say the view was great.

title: Excellent Hotel in Singapore
desc: Great small boutique hotel in Singapore. Very clean and comfortable rooms w all amenities you may need. It’s close to many malls and attractions. If you want to go to the shops at the Marina Sands you may want to take a grab or the train, but not that far at all.

title: excellent level of service
desc: hotel perfectly located in the center city, bedroom clean and convenient, swimming pool on the roof with view all around. A high level of service as never seen, arrived at 9h am room though normally available at 2 pm, we received our room at arrival without any additional charge for early booking and with kindness.

title: Excellent hotel in good position with outstanding staff
desc: Just checked out after 4 night stay. Lovely hotel in good position to see most of Singapore ‘must-sees’. Clean rooms ( a tad small with large suitcases) with comfortable clean bedding and lovely bathroom/shower and ample toiletries, Towels plentiful and clean but could be a little softer given hotel boutique nature. Nespresso machine and free water and soft drinks replenished daily.Tap water safe to use.Breakfast good with ample choice including yoghurts, fruit, cereals , cooked sausages etc plus eggs,, waffles and pancakes to order. Best thing by far was the excellent service by all staff throughout the hotel, the reception staff go above and beyond helpful and always with a smile. Download the Grab taxi app for cheaper taxi travel in Singapore which worked so well for us we

title: 5 Star rating, but without the 5 Star price
desc: Staying next to the Raffles Hotel in the middle of Singapore, near shopping, metro and restaurants should cost a fortune. However, at Naumi, you get all of that, and more but pay a fraction of the 5 Star price. Being situated between two metro stops, near two huge shopping malls and just steps from a great chinese restaurant is what's waiting for you at Naumi. The staff is up beat, helpful and simply terrific. The room is spacious with a great bathroom. Unfortunately, we had a room with a view of an alley, but it was quiet. The second visit several weeks later, we had a better room with a better view.

title: Wonderful Staff!
desc: Traveling without working phone simcard for local calls and internet connection is a burden nowadays. But thanks to the wonderful staff of Naumi, they were very gracious in helping its guests book shows and go about different places in Singapore. I will be forever grateful to the staff who aided me during my short stay. More blessing to all of you who made my stay pleasant and wonderful!

title: Great hotel, great location
desc: This was our first time visiting Singapore so didn’t truly appreciate the hotel’s location until we got there. It is opposite The Raffles, and in a perfect location to access everything the beautiful city has to offer. There are a plethora of things to see and do within a 15-20 minute walk, or a five minute walk to City Hall MRT station. The hotel itself is lovely and clean. The service was fantastic, with a lovely refreshment served on arrival. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great stay, great location, great staff
desc: Stayed 4 nights here with my girlfriend and was really pleased with the level of service. Staff helps you with hangover “cures” or provides extra water when you’re feeling sick. Rooftop pool was nice and quiet and relaxing. Located in a great area that is easily walkable to many spots such as Clarke quay or esplanade. Staff helped out calling taxis and recommended places to eat. Overall a great stay and will definitely stay here next time we are in Singapore

title: Beautiful Hotel - Great Location
desc: We stayed at the Hotel Naumi in March 2019. It is located across the street from the Raffles Gift Shop. If you intend to explore Singapore by foot, this is an excellent central location. It was easy walking distance (10 mins) from Klampong Glam, and under a 1/2 hour to Little India, China Town, Gardens by the Bay, Clarke Quay and other popular destinations. There are innumerable good restaurants in every direction. The Hotel building itself is small by Singapore standards, but very attractive and well maintained. There is a rooftop pool and veranda with very comfy chairs, an infinity pool with a spectacular view and a small bar. We stayed in a Habitat room - very well appointed, small stocked mini-bar with water, pop and a beer - which are included in your stay. They

title: Excellent Small Hotel in Center Singapore
desc: Great little hotel in center Singapore. Access is great with 3 different MRT stations on walking distance, serving 4 different lines. Bus stops were plentiful as well, and of course taxis are not hard to find; the receptionists at Naumi will gladly help should you need one. Rooms are not big, but pretty standard for Singapore. We love the comfort of small hotel, as the rooms are never too far away to reach once you arrived at the hotel floor.

title: Convenient location and a price that well beats its larger neighbors
desc: The hotel is friendly and fashionable. Right behind Raffles (for the must-do Peanuts and Singapore Sling), a block from Raffles City shopping, and easy access to roads to head to the airport or to points West. The breakfast is decent; the prices for evening meals and drinks seem quite high, but did not reference any of the bars on the same street to compare. There are so many places to eat nearby otherwise that a dinner in may only be worth it for the jet-lagged and agoraphobic. The roof deck pool is charming - did not get to indulge, unfortunately, but could see it as a nice respite for one wanting some downtime. The staff are very cheerful and kind.

title: A Gem of a hotel
desc: I spent a week at Naumi with my sons on a family holiday. The staff were friendly & welcoming from the minute ee arrived. The hotel is very well located around 5 minutes from Mariba Bay & easily accessible to most of central Singapore. The rooms are immaculately clean & to a high standard. For a Boutique hotel it's very well run & managed. The rooftop pool area is just lovely with amazing views. My only criticism is the pool bar is not open during the day when its especially hot/humid. You hsve to phone the main lobby to get refreshmemts sent up. The bar atea in teception is small & there's no major facilities or entertainment/ outside dining. There's a couple of local bars outside the hotel that have good ambience & music with a buzzy atmosphere. Drinks outside the

title: Beautiful hotel, great location
desc: I loved this hotel. The staff were really friendly from the moment we walked in, and made everything easy, and even gave a call up to our room when we were up there to make sure everything was how we wanted it. The hotel is really clean, and kept looking classy and has a relaxed atmosphere as everything runs like clockwork. Our room was lovely, had a great shower, and even come with a complimentary minibar and Nespresso coffee machine. The location of the hotel was perfect, as it was walking distance to lots of places like Raffels, and then only 2 stops away on the train to the Marina Bay area. The pool area was lovely too, with great views across the Singapore landscape. So happy we stayed here.

title: Accommodative Staff, Beautiful Room
desc: I booked the room to celebrate my fiance's 30th. The hotel staff were very polite, accommodative and understanding to our needs. The room was amazing! Big, luxurious, with all the right amenities. Pool is 24/7!

title: Perfect location Boutique Hotel
desc: We had 5 nights here it’s our second visit in 18 mths we choose to stay due to the welcoming kindness from our last stay it was very personal it’s location is located in a quite street next to Raffles hotel. It’s walking distance to Marina Bay Area. The staff are very lovely and will go out of there way to help out. The infinity pool is a relaxing area to chill after a long day beautiful views. There a great coffee shop located on the same street if your a coffee lover and need more than one opens daily 7 am. We arrived early this stay 8am we were offered to upgrade to a available room which let us check in early until the next day which was lovely it was $117 Singapore and a complementary breakfast the room was super and really enjoy a night in luxury. If I was to

title: Comfortable room and excellent service
desc: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel arriving quite late on our first evening. We were made very welcome, our cases were taken out of the taxi and up to our room whilst we checked in. The room was quite compact but very comfortable and clean. We both slept very well. Breakfast is buffet style with a reasonable range of cooked and continental items. The rooftop infinity pool provided a reasonable view of the city but more importantly a pleasant respite from the city heat. The hotel is well located- next to Raffles (currently closed for refurbishment) and close to Esplanade MRT station. The day we checked out our flight was late at night. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel and spend the day sightseeing. On returning to the hotel in the evening we were offered the use of a

title: Superb hotel with wonderful staff in an excellent location
desc: We stayed for 3 nights in this super hotel and had an excellent stay. Staff were really pleasant and helpful, location close to City Hall and Raffles City was perfect. The room we had was not large but much thought had gone in to maximising every available nook and cranny. Breakfast was very good with excellent coffee! We have stayed in many different hotels in Singapore but will definitely return to this one.

title: A Gem
desc: There are many hotels from which to choose in Singapore. My wife and I love to explore cities on foot so we wanted to be within walking distance of the Marina Bay area without actually staying in there. Ultimately, the choice of hotel comes down to how you like to travel, and what you require from your hotel. The Naumi Hotel is an 11-story boutique property on a relatively quiet street opposite the huge, historic Raffles Hotel (which, btw, was undergoing a major renovation) so for us, the Naumi was perfect. Great location, great design, clean and comfortable rooms at a reasonable price. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and offered both SE Asian and Western options. Close to great shopping at the Raffles Center and many excellent restaurants. Before we began our trip, we were

title: Hometown welcome, big city style
desc: The Naumi is an awesome boutique hotel across the road from some small place called Raffles...! The location is great, close to the bustle of Boat Quay and Clarke Quay, the waterfront and downtown but tucked away in Seah Street with its collection of smaller bars and restaurants. The staff are so friendly with a personal service missing in larger chain hotels; recommendations, bookings, late check out, use of the pool after check out and a big welcome on arrival and personal wave on departure. The rooms aren’t huge but they are modern and excellently set up so you don’t feel jammed in - plenty of space to work if you have to. The Naumi has a great roof top pool and shady deck overlooking the downtown area - there are renovations underway at the moment but it’s still an awesome

title: Lovely Singapore Hotel
desc: Great location just off Beach Road, beautiful rooms and a nice 10th floor rooftop infinity pool with loungers and facilities for chilling out between trips. Very helpful and friendly staff. I had problems with my phone which made it difficult to check in for the return flight. The reception couldn't have been more helpful in assisting me with the airline check in. Loved our stay.

title: Second stay at Naumi
desc: We stayed a second time at this hotel. The rooms are well designed and equipped for your stay. Pool is lovely with super views - a real plus as well as excellent central location. Staff at check in were over burdened by paperwork which seemed unnecessary. They were helpful when we needed to seek medical assistance. Recommended.

title: Top modern, fresh boutique hotel
desc: Small hotel but very well thought through and designed. Room was modern and had all you needed neatly designed to fit the room. Large, comfy fresh bed, glass clean shower with cosmetic samples available. Tea, coffee free in room. Highlight of this hitel was definitely the roof top pool . wonderful views of the city with infinity pool and lounging area where you could order food and drinks, great Indian food available, nights on the rooftop were unbelievable unreal swimming in the pool and feeling part of the lights and this amazing city, sipping tasty cocktails. Breakfast was not what one expects from a 5 star hotel, not enough choices and not really what Europeans like, I found it disappointing. Location is great you csn reach the city quickly and there are restaurants and a

title: Singapore stopover
desc: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Naumi for one night and it was perfect for our needs. The hotel is really funky and the room was great, everything you need in a well thought out space. Our room looked over raffles (was being renovated at the time but not noisy at all) and we were walking distance to marina bay and the gardens, we also found a great little bar next to hotel that do a great $10 cocktail happy hour and I have to say the cocktails were delicious and the food, yum! The rooftop pool was quiet and the views across to the city are great, such a relaxing space especially after a 14 hr flight! The staff are so helpful and friendly, would stay again and would highly recommend.

title: Lovely little boutique hotel
desc: This is a great little boutique hotel. The rooms are comfortable and carefully fitted out to save space. The shower and toilet are fitted with magic glass. There is a rooftop pool and bar with great views of Singapore. The neighbourhood has some funky little bars dotted with authentic Swee Kee restaurants where many locals eat. It is conveniently located between MRT stations Bugis and City Hall both just a block away. Convenience stores and Raffles city shopping are very close as well. The staff are wonderful and happy to assist in anyway they can. Wonderful Singaporean hospitality.

title: Nice, relaxed hotel in a good location.
desc: Had a very quick trip to Naumi for work. Overall the hotel, amenities and services are great, but the major highlight is the staff - some of the best staff I have experienced at a hotel. Room had everything I needed. The hotel isn't the biggest so could get busy at capacity but I didn't have any issues.

title: First visit @ Naumi - excellent staff & cosy room
desc: As a fellow hotelier I must say the service was excellent & beyond my expectations. Was greeted by 2 wonderful ladies whom I forgot to get the names during my check in on the 20th April 2019 around 2.30pm. Was surprised that they actually bring guest personally to the room and did a mini tour of the room which I could not have found the coffee the machine if not of the room tour. Room was super comfy and bed was furnished with 6 pillows and 1 bolster, perfect for people who likes to snuggle in bed. However, the design of the basin tap was good to look at but not quite practical as water then to splash all over the counter and quite wasteful on water. May not be suitable for people who likes a room with view as the view we were given was facing another building but we were not

title: Nice boutique hotel
desc: The basic room was modern, clean and functional. A bit small though. The rooftop pool is really nice with beautiful view over the city. There is also a gym, or several since it is split into several smaller rooms. I was there alone, so it was spacious enough. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ok, not superb. Overall, I can recommend Naumi and could return.

title: Fabulous hotel
desc: Great location, right next to Raffles and a short walk/taxi ride from Marina Bay Sands. The staff were really friendly and helpful, offering us tea on arrival and upgrading our room to the designer Andy Warhol room. It was amazing! The rooftop pool had fabulous views and was nice and warm. All in all, a fab hotel and we would stay again

title: Great location for singles or couples
desc: What a great location! Naumi is a modern hotel providing lots of convenience for travelers. The roof top pool was delightful, as were the views. We had two rooms (4 adults who are friends) and I would have to say the rooms were a bit too cosy - every inch of space has been used so there is nowhere to stretch or breathe. No ten bed option. The facilities are all modern but a bit over the top. So that would be my criticism: great for a single person or couple. Awesome shopping and restaurants nearby. Loved the grab vouchers!!

title: Excellent on many points
desc: From now, this hôtel will be my HQ in Singapor. (1) The location is perfect (close to many restaurants, shops, cultural venues) (2) The swimming pool on the roof top shares a unique view on the city (3) the staff is by your side before your arrival until your are safely back home and (4) the breakfast and the room service are really good. In April2019, we went there with my wife and my two Young boys. Each member of the staff was dedicated to our well being (proactive, sharp and quick in the answers, smiling, …)

title: Great hotel for the short stay in Singapore 🇸🇬
desc: Hotel was great 👍 Great location, very helpful and pleasant staff, nice breakfast 🥞 If you are still young in heart and body, just a walking distance from main attraction points, including Marina Bay Set, Gardens by the Bay... And pool on the roof was beautiful both during the day and in the late evening 😉 Would recommend the place to everyone!

title: Great boutique hotel
desc: This hotel is not huge and not small and its centrally located opposite Raffles Hotel Gift Shop which means all attractions are within a short walk. In any event, the metro station is only five minutes away and fast frequent trains run to the airport (twenty minutes). Rooms were great, the minibar was complementary too. We didn't eat at the hotel (I thought it seemed expensive and a bit soul-less) however the street outside is full of restaurants and many many more are within a few minutes walk. Recommended!

title: Good & Bad
desc: Stayed in hotel at the month of April. The hotel has an excellent location near by everything. The stuff are excellent and friendly. The hotel is compact which gives you a house feeling with the room equipped with all required amenities. The main problem is the noise from outside street and from inside the hotel while guests closing their room doors. This type of noise really disturbs your sleep.

title: Intimate and luxurious
desc: we are really glad that we picked this hotel to start our stay in Singapore. From the moment we arrived we felt so welcome and we were so impressed with hte room. We had selected a patio room and were happy we had as the extra space was special. Great breakfast too. Very helpful staff, and the rooftop pool overlooking Raffles was superb

title: Clean, modern, cute boutique hotel
desc: Excellent location opposite the Raffles, very clean room, comfortable bed, quiet, nespresso machine in the room as well as free mini bar and snacks, great staff really nice and helplful, beautiful roof top with pool! Just a word of advice: we booked a Habitat room, which is not really big and the bathroom is literally in the room. The sink is in the middle of the room and you enter the shower and the toilet from the room, and the separation is a tinted glass door. So you need to be quite intimate with the person you share with!

title: Alison
desc: Lovely hotel in a great location walking distance to everything. Modern rooms Lovely beds and a good breakfast. The friendly helpful staff did evertyhing they could to make us welcome we checked out in the morning they kept our luggage and we went back from 4 until 6 and used the infinity pool which we loved it has an amazing views of the city which we where very appreciative. Would definitely go back . Very happy guests

title: Had a lot of fun
desc: Loved the pool day and night. Veer the bartender is an excellent addition to the whole ambient there. The hotel room is smaller then I thought but I slept amazing so it didn’t quite matter in the end. The staff overall was great.

title: Beautiful hotel
desc: Went to this hotel in April 2019 for 2 days stay. This is a very good location if you want to stay downtown. Near to the MRT, this hotel offert a beautiful pool on the roof with bar, restaurant and lovely staff to help you. I strongly recommend this hotel!

title: Great place to stay
desc: Thank you for the great time at the Maumi Hotel in Singapore. Friendly staff at all time, nice design room, great roof top with swimming pool. Great location to walk all around Singapore. Highly recommended

title: Excellent location and helpful staff
desc: Stayed here for a work trip since it was a hop skip and jump from my workplace. Pro's Great location, amazing staff, decent sized and equipped rooms with avg view Con's The amenities unfortunately do not justify the cost, maybe it is the location premium. What was disappointing was the breakfast buffet and the cost they charged vis-a-vis the spread. Even though on a work trip I did not want to opt for the breakfast. Considering the cost not sure if I will opt for it. Carlton or the Swissotel are better options.

title: Very dissapointed.
desc: On arrival we saw a sign stating a private event had been booked for the roof top terrace for our second day from 5pm, very annoying as we chose this hotel for the roof top pool terrace area so we could enjoy the view, swim and relax. We arrived back from out sightseeing by 2pm to relax for a couple of hrs knowing the party was at 5pm only to be surrounded by men moving furniture and guests to set up. I left when they put a large buffet table directly infront on me blocking the view and making me feel uncomfortable. My son left 5 mins after we arrived as it was so noisy and we were obviously in the way. Would I stay here again? No! There are plenty of other places to stay in the 5 star range who actually deliver 5 stars. Staff were very nice and check in was good. Beds comfy but

title: Quality boutique hotel
desc: The hotel occupies a good spot right opposite Raffles Hotel and ideally placed for the numerous shops and restaurants nearby. The rooftop bar and terrace offers great views across the city and somewhere to relax after a days sightseeing. The staff at the hotel are friendly and efficient and nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are clean and are beautifully appointed.

title: Good business stay in downton Singapore
desc: This hotel is really well located in Singapore close to many restaurants and bars. The room quality is good even at the lowest price and the staff are friendly and helpful. The only reasons this hotel didnt get a 5 were:- Breakfast range is limited (but sufficient) The pool was shut the afternoon of the only day I could use it and the setup for a 5pm event started at 2:30... which made a lot of noise so I left. I am never sure that a hotel should close advertised services for private functions. You cannot get a late night (11pm) drink at the hotel - but there are bars in the same road. I hope you find the review help - and to summerise I would happily stay here again

title: Airport transfer
desc: We stayed on our way out of New Zealand and enjoyed it so much booked for a night on our return 3weeks later. This is by far a 5star accommodation. We arrived in at 7am on our return after a 12 hour flight the front of house staff (Steven) was extremely helpful and welcoming nothing was a problem and he had our room ready. The rooms are clean, comfortable, well equipped, and they go over and above with amenities. We visit Auckland regularly and have found Naumi Hotel to be one of the best places to stay, especially if you are needing the Airport, international or domestic, Auckland CBD is also not far away. If you're there for breakfast Saibal looks after you as if you are dining in his home, a big 5 Stars for Saibal his hospitality is wonderful. Thank you Naumi we will be back

title: Kuan Ospan
desc: Great location: well connected - City Hall Metro station is 4 minutes away. Has gym and pool for leisure! Friendly smiling staff. Enjoyed the rooftop pool, refreshing. Cool room design with free minibar and Snacks! You should try it as they try harder compared to franchise hotels.

title: Friendly Location Smart place
desc: This is the second time I stayed at Naumi and again I was impressed by the friendliness of the staff, their genuine efforts to help, and the smart well layed out room. This location was suitable for me as I had business at the Raffles and then wanted to go shopping in Bugis. I chose Naumi over a big hotel as it is easier to get in and out of boutique hotels.

title: Great rooms, great staff, great location : perfect stay !
desc: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at Naumi. We really enjoyed our stay here ! Rooms are nice, clean, and comfortable. The staff was also very kind and helpful, and we had a very warm welcome. About the rooftop terrace and infinity swimming pool, it offers a fantastic view on the Singapore's skyline and it was a great pleasure to relax here. At last, the location is perfect, close to all amenities and at walking distance of the very center of Singapore. To conclude : it was a perfect stay and we highly recommend Naumi hotel.

title: Amazing Hotel - Fantastic Room
desc: What an amazing hotel, located 25 min to the airport in the heart of Singapore. Closely located to key tourist locations, Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the Bay and Raffles Hotel. Hotel room was amazing (see photos), stayed in the Andy Warhol Room. Comfortable bed, wonderful bathroom facilities and fantastic chair. Indian inspired menu, room service available and you can receive a set menu with all the trimmings. FANTASTIC AND FRIENDLY staff in all departments.

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location!
desc: We really enjoyed our stay at the Naumi. The clean, modern, spacious rooms are lovely with great design and plenty of amenities. Rooms on the interior are very quiet. Rooftop pool is a real treat with gorgeous views of the city. Staff is very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Easy location for walking to nearby attractions (Marina Bay Esplanade 10 - 15 minutes walking). Raffles hotel and a nice mall 1 block away. Plenty of restaurants very close.

title: Great location but not ideal for travelling with a baby
desc: Excellent staff, superb location and amazing roof top pool. However, I would advise the hotel to take more care when allocating rooms. We booked plenty of months in advance and specified we will be travelling with our 9 month baby. Being placed on the 2nd floor directly above the loud music from the lobby/street area unfortunately ruined our stay. I’d advise to check or think twice about staying here if grabbing an early night or putting a baby to bed was in your plans

title: Very nice hotel, some outside noise
desc: We stayed 3 nights in mid May. It's a cozy boutique hotel, good value and the staff are very friendly and helpful (for example a shower door that needed re - hinging was fixed immediately). Breakfast buffet very enjoyable (please add granola to cereal selection). The only downside is a very noisy pub/bar down the street on Friday and Saturday nights. If you're exhausted from your trip you'll easily sleep through it but otherwise can be a drawback.

title: Friendly, Good Location, Best choice
desc: I stayed in Naumi Hotel for a week for my business trip. The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly, location was amazing and over all very accommodating. I was there during the month of Ramazan. I had to do very early breakfast like at 5:00 a.m. The hotel arranged the early breakfast for me with hot, freshly made eggs and soup. They offered the breakfast in normal breakfast cost. The breakfast was served in the room and there were no extra charges. So I had really good experience and I will suggest Naumi hotel to every one for a happy stay.

title: Boutique sized hotel
desc: So nice to stay for a change to stay a boutique size hotel instead of a large chain hotel Reception staff were outstanding. Room was bright and airy. Although mould in the basin and shower was disappointing. Room for improvement: breakfast had a very limited selection Pool deck. Great view. Bar staff were scruffy and need new uniforms. Mould at the outdoor shower and at the pool stairs / decking area

title: Beautiful Urban Escape
desc: The hotel was exactly what I needed for a business trip, and have great facilities. The room's amenities were great - no need for travel adapters, as they come equipped with international power sockets. They also provide hard-plastic bottles to promote reusing water bottles and reducing plastic waste, which I found fantastic. The staff were friendly and very helpful.

title: Loved this hotel
desc: I had the best 4 nights in the Naumi Hotel. I was travelling solo, so really appreciated the friendly service - everyone who works there is friendly but the reception was outstanding. Loved the room - yoga mat included! - loved the infinity pool, happy hour by the pool, the breakfast and the Indian restaurant which was superb for dinner. Location perfect- next to Raffles and Chjimes, and you can walk to heaps of places by going through the basement of Raffles City, this whole network under the city.

title: NIce but slightly overhyped hotel
desc: This is a cute, but perhaps slightly overhyped (to me) hotel in Singapore. I stayed there for 2 evenings in June, and while I was not disappointed in my stay, it certainly did not "wow" me. The staff were courteous but not overly warm or friendly. The hotel is located in an area with a bunch of bars and restaurants downstairs, but they don't seem to be too noisy/disruptive/boisterous. The check-in area is small (which is fine), and the dining area is nicely sized (and I believe has a few chairs outside as well). I did participate in the breakfast one morning which I found to be adequate but perhaps a little lackluster for a 5 star hotel. Checkin was relatively efficient and I was personally taken to my room and shown where everything was and how it worked. I actually was

title: KNOW ME IS TO LOVE ME
desc: Great location and small enough to stay away from the crowds. The staff were very attentive and helpful in all aspects. Bed and AC performed great. Our only gripes were the lack of TV channels with no HD at all. The slick bathroom floors and multiple guessing what switch goes to what light (~8 switches). Could definitively use brighter lighting in the bathrooms. We stayed on the 6th floor facing the JW Marriott which was good with no outside noise at all.

title: Excellent service from Narae and team
desc: I booked a 1 night stay for my girlfriend and I in the Gabrielle & Camellia room from 15-16 June as I planned to propose during the stay. Prior to the actual day, Narae had been a tremendous help to me, from allowing me to take a look at the room, updating me on the availability of an early check in, assisting with the collection of bouquet and birthday cake, to allowing my friends access to my room in order to surprise my girlfriend. Narae went above my expectations and my proposal would not have so went well without her help. Additionally, my friends told me the birthday cake I ordered had a bit of an ‘accident’ but the hotel and restaurant staff aided in beautifying it again and I can’t thank them enough for stepping up to help on this aspect too. Overall, I thoroughly

title: Great location, room, rooftop pool and friendly service
desc: Just a really seamless stay in a really well presented apartment with very friendly and professional staff. Loved the location and the rooftop pool - gyms are a little small - but you can't have everything surely. Highly recommended.

title: Great stay with beautiful pool
desc: The good: From the second we stepped in, the staff was super friendly and attentive. As we were lucky enough to get a room on the nineth floor, our room had a nice view of the CBD (same view as from the pool). We appreciated the free mini bar (no daily refill of beer or juice though) and the fact that the pool is open around the clock. The infinity pool is lovely, so we spent quite a bit of time there, but the pool bar is unfortunately closed most of the day. The location is quite central with several MRT stations nearby, and if one don’t mind the heat, many sights (such as Arab Street, Boat Quay) are within walking distance. The not so good: Our room felt quite run down. There were stains on the wallpaper, which actually seemed to be improperly glued to the wall along the

title: An invited event
desc: It was a 5 mins walk from City Hall MRT station to the hotel. Hit straight up to the rooftop on my first visit, I was so impressed with the beautiful view and the pool. As well, I was lucky to catch the National Day rehearsal on that evening.

title: Great location, beautiful hotel!
desc: My husband and I really enjoyed this hotel. The design is contemporary and stylish in the lobby and the rooms. The shower pressure was strong. The TV includes AppleTV so you can access streaming platforms like Netflix. We did the breakfast package, which was a great buffet. The location is easily walkable to a lot of the downtown attractions. We are American tourists, and we found that the design was really comfortable for Western travelers, and the staff all spoke English.

title: Worth to pay for the location but not overall service
desc: Great location, easy to walked from MRT City Hall/Esplanade. Very nice rooftop pool, great for relaxing. The Habitat room is compact, in good condition with all amenities you need, free mini bar (soft drinks/fill up every day, beer+ soda+ snacks/only one time of your stay) , nespresso. I'd say the size of the room is fine for solo traveller, but I'm not sure for a couple, quite small for two people maybe. Noise control is not good, can hear the next door closed/opened the door. They have buffet breakfast but not variety of foods. I stayed for 3 days, almost the same menu they served! Staff are friendly, in the way of a boutique luxury hotel service.

title: A Unique Small Hotel with first class amenities and service
desc: I didn't know what to expect when my travel agent booked me into the Naumi Hotel but from the minute I walked in the door until the minute i left, the service was 5 star and more. The hotel is modern with a personal touch, the staff walked me to my room, made sure I understood how things worked and even told me that everything in the mini bar was free. The restaurant serves a good breakfast and this morning the hotel said my breakfast was complimentary. The staff are very helpful and nothing was a problem even when I locked myself out of my room.

title: Perfect if breakfast improves
desc: The hotel is perfect: staff, location, rooms, complimentary mini bar, nespresso machine, roof top infinity pool. Only drawback is the breakfast which is not on a par. Poor pastries, bread quality, sausages. Only the fruit juices are great. Little simple improvement needed.

title: Excellent
desc: We loved our stay here, your fantastic staff should be congratulated. The best hotel we have ever stayed at. Loved everything about it. Thankyou for a very enjoyable stay in beautiful Singapore. We certainly hope to return.

title: A breath of fresh air in Singapore
desc: We only stayed overnight, but this was a delightful and welcoming small hotel. Check-in and out were easy and pleasant. The room was very comfortable and free minibar was a nice change.The pool and pool deck are the real stars. It's really a remarkable mid level view that takes in the Singapore Eye, convention, some harbour and some very interesting architecture. It's tempting to stay in the pool area for most of your stay! The hotel is in a great area near City Hall and the small restaurants in the street behind Raffles. A definite contender if you like low key luxury. Good for business or leisure traveller.

title: The best boutique hotel yet
desc: I booked Eden Room at Naumi, and am immediately delighted by the coziness and warmth. It's beautiful and extremely CLEAN!!!!! The huge bathtub makes us happy!!!!! The bed and blanket heavenly!!! The staff even prepared a cake/brownie for my partner coz it was his birthday! Everything is just soooooo awesome and it's definitely my fav place as of now, for a staycay. Ps.. the only downside was the toilet didnt have a bidet/water spray attached to it.. and the shower area is a few steps away from the toilet.. so I had to literally shower (waistdown) every single time after toileting. Hahahaha. Oh! And of course, the complimentary minibar is an added plus points for the one night stay. Will definitely make a comeback to experience the other designer rooms.

title: Naumi hotel
desc: Amazing hotel with really good facilities and amenities The staff is really helpful and nice The rooftop bar has an amazing view and ambience the bartender at the bar whose name is Veer is very experienced, knows his work and is good company

title: Party gathering
desc: I went there for a party gathering, nice cozy rooftop with spectacular view, love it! “GREAT HOSPITALITY” friendly host! The location for Naumi is so convince, near orchard shopping paradise, surround with food paradise ”bugis” & ”Arab street” with different kind of cultures entertainment.

title: Lovely hotel but too many kids!
desc: My partner and I stayed here last weekend-lovely hotel, great location and staff were very helpful. The pool was a huge selling point for us and was advertised as somewhere you could relax... unfortunately this was not the case! The pool was dominated by small children running, jumping and splashing around. Such a shame as the pool area is a great space, but would be so much more relaxing if it were a child free zone. One other thing is the breakfast could definitely be improved- not much choice for expensive for what you got.

title: Perfect
desc: We stayed here the last three nights of our one month trip to Thailand and Singapore. The staff was very nice, the view from the pool was spectacular. The bar seemed to be open late, breakfast was excellent. next doo was an amazing Mexican cafe, we ate there twice.

title: Okay service but beautiful rooms
desc: Celebrated our anniversary and we thoroughly loved the design of the hotel. As a Naumi member, I was given an upgrade to the beautiful Eden & Nirwana room (Andy Warhol inspired) and we were so amazed at how huge the bathtub was! The bed was so comfy and we were delighted by the surprise dessert to celebrate our special day. The service was abit poor from most of the staff we encountered (they seem to be nicer to foreigners than locals) - except for May. She was lovely, polite and always greeted us with a smile. Thank you May, you were the saving grace of Naumi.

title: Cammelia room got us!
desc: We loved this property! Hotel has a strong personality which you can breathe all over the hotel. The receptionist was coming with us into the room and explain the concept and the facilities in there. We got a really nice room called Cammelia which was having both a shower and bath tune. The pool at 10th floor has a great view and the common area have comfortable and stylish deck chairs. Breakfast was good even though not so much variety. The staff was really helpful and supportive - even though there was no proper stuff for the luggage transport up the the floors. After we left we got a nice thank you note from the staff.

title: Perfect!
desc: A perfect place to visit Singapore! We liked the area near the mytic raffles hotel. So beautiful hotel, very good service, amazing « terrasse » with a beautiful view on Singapore. Thanks a lot for our stay, we enjoyed it!

title: Fantastic service
desc: We arrived early in the morning and the staff were fantastic- our room was not ready but they gave us towels, access to a shower and the pool. The rooms were of a good size and a good shower Views from the pool are amazing

title: Fantastic hotel with gorgeous pool.
desc: Our family of four loved this hotel, there were so many little touches that made it special. We particularly appreciated the Nespresso coffee machine (& pods) whilst our teenagers enjoyed the pool. They managed three swims over our two night stay & were the only ones in it each time. Although it says the pool times are 7am-6pm you can actually go in anytime. The staff were all really lovely & the only thing wrong with our stay was that we weren't there longer.

title: Magical...!
desc: Our stay was amazing :) We stayed in one of Naumi’s designer rooms with awesome art and a beautiful bath! Renée and I loved our stay! The team made us feel warm and at home. The location is exceptional. Thanks Naumi!

title: Perfect stopover in Singapore
desc: Second visit to hotel.Stayed in quirky, contemporary, spacious Andy Warhol room. The hotel gave us an early check-in, in an upgraded room at a reasonable additional payment.This suited us as arrived in the early morning from London.The reception staff were friendly and helpful particularly Jinny.The rest of the staff gave us the same attention. The room on the first floor at the back was in a quiet area with not a great view but this was not an issue.The room had a gigantic bath tub with an enormous rain shower.The floor was showing some wear but this did not bother us at all.The hotel is located very near the iconic Raffles hotel and Raffles City shopping centre.

title: Stayed for F1
desc: Lovely boutique hotel with some nice individual decor. Naumi felt intimate, calm and chic - I don’t like big hotels however posh they are. We had a habitat room. Spacious except it could do with a few more shelves to unpack. Took a while to realise toilet and shower had ‘magic glass’ as it appears clear! Comfortable stay. Nice buffet breakfast or other options nearby. Friendly helpful staff. Gorgeous roof top infinity pool and bar area with a view of Raffles and towards Padang. Easy walking to the F1 street circuit.

title: A lovely oasis
desc: I just loved staying at the Naumi. It's a quirky boutique hotel with funky art and a great layout. The staff were attentive and responsive whenever we asked for anything. In a sea of high end 6 star hotels in Singapore it was lovely to have something different to come home to. The roof top pool and bar is fabulous. We sat there and listened to the Grand Prix roar past us while watching it on the tv! I will definitely come back.

title: Overall stay great, but....
desc: We stayed here whilst in Singapore for the Grand Prix, and the location of the hotel for that and lots of local restaurants and bars was excellent. Like a lot of the reviewers say this hotel is really stylish, some really good design features, but there are just a few things that we experienced that don’t quite push it to 5 stars We booked through Agoda. This meant that despite the fact we were staying there five nights we didn’t qualify for some of the perks of booking direct gets you. The room cleaning was a bit hit and miss. We would leave quite early in the morning to get back about 4/5 pm and in some cases our room was in the process of being serviced. After being in 30+ degree heat all day and just wanting to get back and showered this was quite frustrating, as it meant

title: Superb boutique hotel
desc: This is a fabulous boutique hotel, in a fabulous location..... a gem. The rooms are quirky, with nice touches such as free soft drinks out of the mini bar and plastic water containers that you can take away with you to reduce on plastic. The top floor pool is lovely, and swimming late at night overlooking Singapore is real treat. The staff were extremely helpful; nothing was too much trouble. We ate lunch there and it was reasonably priced and delicious. So why not 5 stars? Simply poor communication. The initial confirmation email we received was unintelligible..... a string of characters..... so we couldn’t check the details of the booking. On arrival they advised that breakfast wasn’t included in our rate, and would cost $20 extra per person. We declined it and went

title: Average stay overall
desc: We booked 3 nights here through a last-minute discount via Agoda. Overall it was a nice stay but had both pros and cons. Pros -Location is amazingly handy. Raffles nearby, close to transport for all parts of the city, shopping malls nearby, and all sorts of food at the doorstep (just on Seah St and behind on Purvis St) -Pool on Level 10 was awesome. Not huge, but really nice view overlooking the city and Raffles (nice food too! Chomped down on some samosas at 10pm when we got in). Pool is 24/7 too. -Rooms were pretty cool and trendy, with a nice focus on sustainability and design. All minibar and nespresso coffee was included which is a plus. -Staff were very helpful and polite for every request we had. Cons -Didn't quite feel 4.5/5 star - some of the smaller details and

title: Good hotel
desc: Very nice convenient hotel. Rooms are very clean with an awesome comfy bed. Great roof top bar with views. Helpful staff. Only gripe was we arrived early morning after 12hour flight and had to pay extra for room otherwise we would be hanging about for 6 hours. Irritating but not a show stopper. Would stay again

title: Excellent Hotel
desc: The location is great very central and just across from Raffles . Staff were very efficient and friendly.The rooftop had a great view especially at night although the pool was a bit too warm to be refreshing.The room was almost perfect but had a few little things wrong like the weird shower set up which flooded the floor and wet the blind, also the doors in front of fridge and safe were off their hinges.And the towels were scratchy not fluffy.But these are small thing which would not change my suggestion that you stay here.

title: Delightful!
desc: Stayed in Naumi Hotel pretty much on a whim, having walked past the hotel last time I was in Singapore and thought it looked rather good. The whim was a good one - a delightful place to stay with a killer rooftop bar / pool that also serves excellent (really excellent) Indian food. The staff were delightful, and nothing was a task for them. I will be back, and recommend Naumi highly for people looking for a slightly different and more personal stay in the absolute heart of Singapore.

title: Missed the mark on the details
desc: Stayed here for one night as part of a longer business trip, to escape the boring business hotels. There were some nice things in the room, like the quartz marble sink with underlighting, the large (and comfortable) bed and high rain shower. I found the room to be quite spacious. The roof infinity pool was small but nice, whith a great view over the rooftops. Decor in the room was fairly neutral. However, when a hotel advertises itself as boutique and luxury, then I expect that they will pay attention to small details, and that just wasn't the case in my experience here. It wasn't a bad hotel, but it really missed the mark on a few basic things, which left me feeling disappointed. First of all, even though there was a nespresso machine in the room, there were no coffee cups,

title: Funky, contemporary & great location
desc: We loved it here. The staff couldn’t do enough for us and worked hard to make it a smooth & great stay. Loved the decor & trendy furniture. The roof top bar & infinity pool were magical with views over the city & across the road from Raffles. Ideal for a short stay. Not much storage in the rooms for longer stays but good use of space. My only criticism would be the towels & loo paper which were not luxury. Towels would be very welcome if they were thicker and felt less worn. Minor point though. We’d go back in a heart beat.

title: Amazing place to stay in Singapore
desc: I really loved my stay at Hotel Naumi. The staff were very helpful and professional, and allowed me to check-in early. The room is perfect for a short stay and is not too small. The view from the pool is to die for and was the highlight of my time in Singapore. It was so nice after being outside in the hot, humid weather to lie in the shade by the pool with the incredible view. The hotel is in a good location as well. Eating at the hotel, however, is extremely expensive. One of the staff was a little impolite on a couple of occasions, but this was probably a miscommunication from both of us. I liked the hotel's focus on sustainability and I would definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic
desc: Hands down best hotel in Singapore. Great hospitality and fantastic value. The pool view may not be that of the MBS, but in some ways it's better since you are closer to downtown. Also, it is never near as crowded! Breakfast was also a great value. We stayed in the habitat room, was small (like most hotels in Singapore) but had everything you need and smart storage spaces. Would recommend to anyone visiting Singapore

title: Fantastic Location Fantastic Staff
desc: My wife and i stayed here on an overnight stopover. After a long flight we asked for an early check in..No problem at all. Wonderful greeting and service. Free drink om arrival.Which we enjoyed later. Singapore Sling to die for. Lovely large room, Infinity pool, brilliant location. Very central and walking distance to all sights. Absolutely use this hotel again and recommend it

title: A disappointing end of a fantastic two weeks...
desc: We flew from London to KL, stayed in a great Airport Hotel for the night, then on to Borneo with two nights in three different lodges up the river, then onto a relaxing few days in Shangrela. Over the previous 11 days we’d experienced the height of luxury and some basic lodges, however, we knew what we were getting with all of them. When we arrived in Singapore we checked into Naumi and we’re led to believe we’d got some luxury in a boutique hotel... this is not the case! We were told breakfast was until 11am, when we went for breakfast it had finished at 10:30. The room we had, 302, was not noise insulated to the party scene on the road or the internal glass doors. The room was small, but that’s a matter of opinion, I just didn’t appreciate the

title: Lovely hotel in good location
desc: My husband and I stayed at Naumi for three nights on our way from the U.K. to Australia. We were so pleased that our room was ready for us when we arrived from the airport at 9am so that we could shower and change and make the most of our first day. The hotel is well situated, just over the road from Raffles and an easy walk to Gardens by the Bay. The rooftop pool was great, the staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were really comfortable. Breakfast was a bit disappointing but there are plenty of other options locally.

title: Short stay in Singapore
desc: A fantastic boutique hotel in the Raffles precinct. Staff were amazing. Friendly and always helpful. The room was very comfortable and good size for the price in Singapore. Easy access to some good bars and restaurants and some of the local sights worth exploring. Highly recommend

title: Best hotel in Singapore
desc: Stopped off in Singapore on our way to Bali and it was the perfect place to get used to the far east heat and attempt to get over jetlag. Lovely room, waking distance to all of the things we wanted to see, and the rooftop pool - my god it was out of this world with a stunning view of the Singapore skyline. The staff were very helpful and friendly too.

title: Great location and a Personal touch
desc: Stayed at Naumi for 2 nights in Singapore before heading off to Thailand. Having never stayed in the country, we were a bit overwhelmed with the choice of hotels, but so glad we picked out Naumi. This is a smaller hotel than many, and it benefits from that by all the team making your stay feel personal and very welcoming. It definitely has a boutique type feel, with really nice touches in the room. Firstly, it is in a great location. Overlooking Raffles hotel, you can easily pop in for an obligatory Singapore sling. The marina Bay Area is only a 20 minute easy, safe walk away and the more central points of Orchard Rd and Bugis are again within 30 mins walking. The rooms themselves,as in many big cities, are on the compact side, but Naumi have done a fab job of creating lots

title: 7 days of cold showers...
desc: This hotel is in a good location and easy to get around, it was minutes walk to our office on beach road so seemed like a good option. Upon arrival, check in was excellent. Couldn’t ask for a better service. The lady was super polite and helpful. However it all went downhill from there. This hotel has a pretty uncomfortable bed, leading to minimal sleep and a totally screwed up neck. The shower only has a 40L hot water capapcity- basically you get about 4 mins of hot water, followed by 6 mins of Luke warm water and then cold. In complained, they sent a “technician” to the room who just ran his hand under the tap and said no issues. I argued the point and then was told about the 40l cap on the water. Was told to switch the shower off mid shower and wait for the water to

title: Underwhelmed
desc: I was very excited to stay @ Naumi after reading some impressive reviews here on tripadvisor! Unfortunately I was left feeling underwhelmed for the price we paid, I expected some things to be much better. PROS - Great location, awesome staff and very comfortable bed and bedding. However in relation to that bedding the blind in the room does not stop midway it can only stay completely up or down. UP the room is filled with outside lights and down it is pitch black. CONS - The breakfast is really poor we struggled to find something to eat! There are no healthy options, the eggs were undercooked and hot items were unappetising. That leaves bread, cheese and spinach leaves. The cleaning is a bit lack lustre only one towel provided even thought 2 of us staying in the room.

title: Contemporary, well located hotel in the Raffles area
desc: Very contemporary, well located small hotel in the heart of the Raffles area. Lots of very interesting contemporary art throughout the property. Staff was very welcoming and friendly, including the general manager, Michelle Tng. Breakfast was diverse and plentiful, and staff was prompt to refill coffee and tea. The hotel is so contemporary, with so many electronics and special features for storage, that it takes a staff person to introduce a new guest to their room. The rooms are relatively small, but far from cramped. We were on the second floor above the street, and the room was acceptably quiet. It appeared that about half of the guests were there on business and half were tourists. The roof top bar and pool is a wonderful quiet oasis, with beautiful nighttime views.

title: Business In Style
